oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mary Scales oral history
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Scales, Mary Caruthers
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Excerpts of an oral history with Mary Scales, the first full-time African-American professor at MTSU. Scales shares her memories of campus life as an African-American graduate student at MTSU during the 1960s, the MTSU Upward Bound program, race relations, and her experiences as an MTSU mathematics professor

1. Scales' experiences with Upward Bound and as MTSU's first African-American full-time professor -- 2. Scales' experiences on an Interracial Committee during the 1970s -- 3. Scales' experiences as Alpha Kappa Alpha advisor
